overview:
## Discussion

If you display an AR experience using a custom Metal renderer, use this value to determine how much motion blur to apply to your virtual content.

If [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNView] is your renderer, SceneKit automatically applies motion blur to your virtual content. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNView/rendersMotionBlur].

# exposureDuration

**Instance Property**

A value you use to effect motion blur when rendering your app’s virtual content.

## Declaration

```swift
var exposureDuration: TimeInterval { get }
```

## Discussion

If you display an AR experience using a custom Metal renderer, use this value to determine how much motion blur to apply to your virtual content.

If [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNView] is your renderer, SceneKit automatically applies motion blur to your virtual content. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSCNView/rendersMotionBlur].
title: exposureDuration
